REVIEW: Dec 28 2007 	Best in Chicago for My Money!	There is no hotel in downtown Chicago that gives you so much for your money. The Homewood Suites is NOT a fancy hotel. It does not exude class and high society. If that's what you are seeking, go elsewhere.If you are looking for a clean, comfortable hotel with plenty of leg room, this is it.The Homewood Suites Chicago is in an awesome location. One block from Michigan. ESPN Zone shares the same building.We have stayed at the Amalfi and the James. Both "classier" hotels. Both of those two I recommended. But the Homewood Suites was less thanhalf the money of those two and had a free full breakfast. There is nobreakfast at the James and the Amalfi only offers pastries. The staff at the Homewood Suites was outstanding. I needed ice. They were at my room with ice in 3 minutes with a full 10-pound bag.The refrigerator, microwave, stove, wireless internet and plasma TV really helped to make this hotel a great place to stay.NO ELABORATE LOBBYNO FANCY ARTWORKJust lots of comforts and an awesome and attentive staff.THIS IS THE HOTEL I WILL STAY AT FROM NOW ON.- RichardS_7

Dec 27 2007 	A pretty good choice.......	We got a great deal by booking at the hotel website with a pay in advance, non refundable rate. Based on other reviews I expected an unbeatable experience so my expectations may have been too high. The best thing about the hotel is the service. Every single employee acted as though this was beyond a five star establishment; polite, friendly, just great. Someone else said the bathrooms were modern and I quite disagree. The vanity area was tiny and the bathroom did not look updated. The kitchen was large and nice. The fold out sofa was 'springy' according to my 8 yr old but comfortable. She hated the carpet, which I have to agree with, it was a yucky color and a strange uncomfortable texture for bare feet. The master bedroom had a very comfortable bed with oodles of pillows and a very fluffy comforter. My biggest disappointment may have been the view. It was of the roof of the ESPN building and a large parking garage which lit up like the sun all night. I am attaching a photo of the best angle of downtown I could get but it still wasn't much of a view, certainly not good for people watching. Room service calls go directly to PF Changs which cracked me up though we did not use it. Overall the service, location and rate were excellent but I might just try their sister property, the Hilton Garden Inn next door next time.

Dec 14 2007 	Convenient and comfortable	We were surprised by the size of the suite. The bedroom was big and luxuriously appointed. The bathroom was modern, the kitchenette well equipped, the LCD TV's were great. The entire apartment was clean and attractive.It is located within walking distance from great places to eat. We also walked to Navy Pier and the Tourist Office. The bus trip is worth the money to get an idea of where what is.The staff at the apartments are very helpful, even at 03:00 in the morning. They also offer a shopping service which cut down on our time spent in grocery outlets.The breakfast was good - great choice and every morning there are different dishes on offer.We would definitely stay here again. Good value for money and good location.Chicago is a beautiful city.

Dec 13 2007 	What a great hotel	Stayed from 2 - 9th December in this great hotel. Great staff - so helpful and friendly and each time we returned we were greeted with a "welcome back" from the guys at the door.The suite was great and had absolutley everything you might need. Good bedroom with really comfortable bed. Living area/kitchenette with microwave, hob, toaster, dishwasher and fridge freezer (complete with ice-making machine). Broadband connection in the room and free use of office facilites for printing etc.The hotel is convenient to the bus and underground with lots of good restaurants in the vicinity and great shopping in the mall opposite. Michigan Ave is within easy walking distance and a short ride on the underground or bus takes you to Macys etc or if you prefer a taxi is around $6. Breakfast is provided each day and there is a manager's reception Mon - Thurs which provides buffet food with beer, wine and soft drinks included. Tea/coffee is available all day at reception.All in all a great place to stay.

Dec 5 2007 	Perfect location - downtown Chicago	We stayed here for three nights at the end of November based on the Tripadvisor reviews we had read and we were not disappointed! It was a perfect location for shoppping, bars and restaurants and the staff were really helpful and friendly.The breakfast each morning was an added bonus - there was anything from fruit and yogurt to a cooked breakfast (even waffles and syrup!) with about 5 choices of bagel! You could even take your breakfast upstairs with you if you would rather have it in your suite.... I saw quite a few guests in PJ's filling up their take out boxes in the morning.Our room had a seperate dining and kitchen area (with coffee supplied), a tv lounge, a dressing area, a bathroom and a huge bed that I wanted to bring home it was so comfortable. There was also a big screen Tv at the end of the bed with loads of channels and pay per view movies - perfect for watching while getting over the Jet lag! Michigan Ave is about two blocks away and it is great for shopping... Although State st is better and is a small cab ride (about $6) away. Macys on washington and state is amazing!There is free tea, coffee and hot chocolate available in reception allday which is perfect for when you are finished your long day of shopping and just want to unwind. We missed the complimentary dinner as we stayed over a weekend - this is only available Mon - Thurs.Make sure you check out heaven on seven - the nicest soul food outside of New Orleans! it was divine and is only around the corner from the hotel. The sushi place next door is really nice but be careful not to order too much! the prices are so cheap you think you won't have enough food!Anyway, when we go back to the windy city, and we are going back, we will stay here again which is as high a recommendation as I can give it!

Nov 14 2007	Superb Value and Great Staff	We just stayed 3 nights in November at this great value hotel - we chose it reading other reviews on Trip Adviser and were not disappointed.The suites are a decent size with a kitchen area with microwave, dishwasher and coffee pot (coffe and tea provided). Everything was spotless - we got a room on the 17th Floor with a really nice city view.The staff were brilliant, from the friendly doormen to the reception and dining room staff. Everyone without fail were helpful and pleasant - something you don't find in all Hiltons. It is hard to beat the added value that comes from good breakfast and a complimentary Managers Special in the evening served between 5 to 7pm. This included wine and beer (you help yourself) and a light dinner of soup, salads and a choice of 4 hot dishes such as one meat, a potato, a veg and a pasta dish - which again you help yourself to, it was quite substantial and anyone not wanting to leave the hotel after a long day would find it very welcoming.Coffees and teas were always available free in reception area as well, there was also to go cups.There are countless restaurants close by and any amount of bars 2 blocks down on Hubbard Street - try Howl at the Moon for a good laugh, duelling Pianos and the musicians taking requests to play and sing any song you ask. Couldn't believe how many different songwords they must know!Only found out on last day but there is a free to use business centre behind reception for internet if you didn't bring a laptop as we didn't coming from UK. This was very handy.You can take a taxi in from the airport O'Hare, but it is quite a long way. We decided to catch the train in after reading it here on TA - it was so easy and cheap - only cost us $2 each compared to a $50 taxi ride, we took that option going back as well. To do this you follow the signs from the airport (after baggage claims) I think you go up in the lift to the next floor. Board the blue line train from airport and change once at Jackson (free transfer) you get off at Grand (Red). You come up steps to street level at Grand and carry on walking directly from there about a block and Homewood Suites is just across the road - couldn't be easier.Finally, this was our first time in Chicago (although we have visited many other parts of US) and we found this to be one of the friendliest cities ever. The people are so genuinely nice and everyone seems to want to help with queries or if you look at all lost someone will stop and ask if you need directions or something. The city river and lake area is lovely to explore and although I wouldn't describe it as exciting like NY, I think it has a lot to offer and we will most certailnly go there again as we had a lovely all round experience with Chicago. If I can help with any queries please be my guest and email me, I intend to write a trip report soon as well when I get over my jet-lag!

Nov 1 2007 	Great Location 	This hotel is in such a great location. It is just steps away from Michigan Avenue, and surrounded by many great restaurants. It is a $10.00 taxi ride to the McCormick Place Convention Center, which isn't bad, because there is only one hotel near McCormick, and if you stay there you are near nothing else. The rooms are very large at the Homewood Suites and very similar to any other Homewood Suites. I had the 2 room version room, which are the rooms with the even number room numbers. Those rooms face the Hancock Tower and down onto Ohio Avenue. The smaller rooms with the odd numbers face the Chicago river. The hotel serves breakfast every morning and it is great. Make them yourself waffles, fresh fruit, bagels & pastries, cereal, and always different "bulk" items such as scrambled eggs or biscuits and gravy, bacon, sausage, and potatoes. The staff in the dining area are very attentive, and always on standby. If you need anything at this hotel in the way of recommendations on dining, attractions, or transportation you need to speak to Ron at the front door. This guy will bend over backwards for you whenever he is there. Enjoy your stay.

Oct 22 2007 	Nice hotel nice staff good location	I recently stayed at the Homewood Suites during a business meeting that was held at the hotel. The most positive aspects were the hotel staff who were pretty nice upon check in. The breakfast was also good, and the rooms were spacious. There was also free wireless internet in the rooms, which was appreciated. The red line train was only a block away. The downsides: Certain aspects of the room appeared dated. The carpet was frayed in areas and the bathroom set up was odd. The area where the sink was didn't have a towel bar and seemed a bit cramped. Also, when I received my bill there were two nights worth of valet parking charged to the bill even though I didn't have a car. This was removed after a few visits to the front desk. Also, I would not recommend holding a meeting at this hotel. They just were not set up to handle all of the logistics of a 21st century meeting and the space was rather cramped.I thought it was pricey ($200/night group rate) for what you got, but that may be the norm in Chicago. Also, they overbooked and had to send some of the conference attendees to another hotel. The conference attendees should have been given top priority since their meeting was at the hotel.

Oct 3 2007	Very Good	We realy enjoyed our stay at the Homewood Suites. Suite was spacious and clean. Location is very convenient to center of Mag Mile. Grand subway station on the Red Line is 2 short blocks away. Free breakfast had wide variety and good quality. The free Mgr's reception on weekday evenings had a wide choice of food, including hot entrees, salads, soup, desert, beer and wine. We thought there would be just snacks but it was more than enough for dinner.Pool is on the top floor. Its not huge, but not small either. There was a small fitness room - just treadmills and aerobic machines, no weights. There's also an Executive room on the 6th floor with free internet access and printers to print boarding passes. I think there was free wi-fi in the hotel as well.Would recommend this hotel to anyone. There were surprisingly few families with kids staying over the weekend we were there. Instead, it seemed a mix of tourists and business people were staying at the hotel.

Sep 3 2007 	really good	we stayed at homewood in late august for a week and were really pleased that we chose to stay here! The suites are really well sized, with a big bedroom, large seating area with a huge TV and a good size kitchen with everything that you may need, plus the views (we stayed at the front of the hotel, opposite Nordstrom) were fantastic!!! Breakfast is really good, lots of choice, and the welcome home dinner (FREE!) is really good quality stuff (we had philly steak, burgers, mac cheese, saussage and chips, plus snacks and pudding!) and will definately save you money. The location couldn't be better, round the corner from pleanty of eateries, one block from the mag mile, one block from the red line (grand), and within very easy walking distance of the river and then the loop. The top floor pool and small work out room are also good, and seemed not be used that much. The hotel seemed to be busy during the week, but quiter and full of families at the weekend.

Sep 1 2007 	perfect for family with teens!	Hotel was perfect for family with 2 teens for 3 days. Our one bedroom suite was very spacious: large bedroom with 2 double beds, tv, sink/vanity outside bathroom. large bath (in fact, wish it had a sink there too, as there certainly is room). Living room was large enough for all four of us to comfortably hanging out there and watch a movie, with a sleep sofa, easy chair, desk/table with chairs, full kitchen including large fridge. It's modern, housekeeping and front desk services were good. Breakfast had multiple choices in a nice clean room with very pleasant staff (mediocre eggs, good fruit, coffee and juices, yogurt, donuts, bagels, eng. muffins, cereal, etc). Hotel is across street from Nordstrom's "mall" with nice shops, one block from good supermarket, one block from subway to Wrigley Field, same block as Navy Pier trolley stop. We walked easily from here to Mag Mile, to Chicago Architecture Foundation boat tour, Millenium Park and Art Insitute of Chicago. Pool is very small here, free acess to great Crunch gym next door.

Aug 30 2007	Very good downtown hotel	This hotel has a very good location, being just one block from the magnificent mile, as well as having pizzeria uno and the espn zone just around the block (although it was a little hard to get to with all of the one-way streets, etc.).The hotel has valet parking, although it is expensive, which is probably the case at any hotel in the area.The rooms are very nice and had everything that we needed for our stay. My only complaint was that the wireless internet was very inconsistent.The breakfast is good and includes eggs, potatoes, lots of baked things, and some fruit. On weekdays, they serve dinner food from 5-7, but we didn't take advantage of it, as there are lots of great restaurants in the area, but it could be a good way to save some time/money.My only other complaint was that the elevator moved very fast and I often felt dizzy after riding on it, although I can't ride on rollercoasters, so this might not be an issue for other people.

Aug 27 2007	Great value for the family	We arrived early on Aug 23 and they were able to accomodate our early arrival which was nice. The room was a 1 room suite, very clean, which I was glad about because I hate to stay in a hotel that feels dirty. My only complaint was that we had to call housekeeping twice for toilet paper. They never left a spare roll. The free breakfast was a plus! It is very crowded and you may have to wait to be seated, but you are welcome to take a to go container and go back to your room if you are in a hurry. It was a nice breakfast too, eggs, hashbrowns, biscuits & sausage gravy, etc. The location was perfect. Close to shopping. Did take a taxi to the Field Museum area which only ran aroun 12.00. We did try taking the free trolley, and it was more of a hassle that what it was worth. We waited and wasn't able to get on because it was crowded, ended up taking a taxi. The next time we did get on we had to switch to get to a different one to take us to the Navy Pier, all in all it took an hour to get from the museum area to Navy Pier. Next time, we will cab it. I wouldn't recommend Gino's pizza. We thought it was horrible. We definately should have done Pizzeria Uno. If we go back, we would definately stay at this hotel. The staff was very nice and the location was great.

Aug 26 2007 	Would Stay at Homewood Again	My wife and I just returned from a 5 night stay (Aug 19-24) at Homewood Suites. We found the Homewood on the web and then checked the reviews on trip advisor before making our reservations. We paid $179 a night and were more than happy with our selection.LOCATION: The location on E Grand was excellent for those sites we wanted to see. Go left out the front door and go about a block and half, then up the stairs to the second level street and reach N. Michigan (the Magnificent Mile). Or you can continue down E Grand until you reach the Navy Pier. / Turn right out the front and go around the corner to Pizzeria Uno for a Chicago style pizza. Continue straight instead and in another block you will reach the Grand subway station on the Red Line. We found the Red Line route, supplemented by buses on ocassion, would take us to the majority of the places we were going (Wrigley Field, Field Museum, Museum of Science and Industry, Shedd Aquarium, Millennium Park, etc). There was also a grocery neaby the hotel which came in handy with the full kitchen in our suite.STAFF: The staff were excellent for the most part. The only problem we encountered was that our room was not available at check in time. Although we were waiting in the lobby we had to keep checking back with the desk to find out when our room was finally ready.LOBBY: The hotel has very little frontage at street level, with the lobby actually being on the 6th floor. We always found coffee, tea, and cocoa in the lobby with "to go" cups and lids available to take it back to your room. Just off the lobby was the dining room.DINING ROOM: The dining room served a buffet style breakfast each morning and on Mon - Thu a buffet meal in the evening. We found these meals, which were included with the price of the room, to be very convenient. You could either eat in the dining room or fix you plates to take back to your room. The staff in the dining area were especially friendly.OUR ROOM: We had a full kitchen area, a sitting area (TV), a separate bedroom (TV), and a bathroom which was only accessible from the bedroom. As there was only the two of us this arrangement worked just fine with us. The only quirk was that the bathroom sink and small counter were actually in the bedroom. The relatively large bathroom only contained a toilet with a towel rack above it and the bathtub/shower combo. There was not even even a towel rack or hooks neat the bathtub for hanging up towels or clothes which was reachable from the bathtub. Also, would have liked to seen at least a small shelf available in the bathroom for those of us who wear glasses or for toiletries.The pluses far out weighted the minuses for us. We would not hesitate staying here again at or near the same price.

Aug 22 2007 	Great For a Family	My family of four, including 7 year old twins, stayed here 3 nights. Location couldn't be better; very easy to find; close to shopping, trolleys, etc. Rod wins the #1 Bellman Award, hands down!!!We had a one bedroom suite, & we used the sofa bed as our 2nd bed. I didn't sleep on it, but my husband said it was fine; no bar down the middle that he could feel. Our room was clean; no complaints. Our icemaker didn't make ice, so I called guest services & someone came w/in 10 min w/a bucket of ice (turns out, the ice maker was turned off! Duh!).The breakfasts were great. It's served in a "dining room" so depending on what time you arrive, you may have to wait for seating. We ate around 9-9:30 each morning & we had to wait 10-20 min each morning. Lots of your typical hot & cold foods; hot foods change each day. They run out of stuff quickly at peak times, but there were always several staff members tending to the food & refilling, etc. You can take your food back to your room, if you like, then you don't have to wait for seating.On weekdays they also serve a dinner. We went on pizza night, & brought it back to our room to eat. We all liked it.Everyone we encountered were very friendly. Only one incident where I was inquiring about the video games in the room, how they're charged, etc. & the person I talked to had no idea what she was talking about. I talked to someone else later & got the correct info.We valet parked our car, & upon check out discovered that we could leave our car there while we explored the city, & come back for it (& our luggage) when we were ready to go home. Nice.I would stay here again if we visit Chicago again, which I hope we do.

Aug 18 2007 	Great Location	This hotel has an excellent location right next to the Magnificant Mile shopping area. It also is close to the theatre district and Navy Pier.The breakfast and happy hour refreshments are great with Happy Hour being able to give you a full meal if you so wish. The staff are friendly and able to supply stuff you may have forgotten, such as a razor or sewing kit, at no cost, unlike some other hotels.My room was large and well presented. My only complaint was that the air conditioning never got cool enough.A good stay.

Aug 8 2007	Great for families	Our family stayed at the Homewood Suites Downtown Chicago-E Grand Ave. in April.This location was excellent, just 2 blocks off Michigan Ave. shopping. Many restaurants within a 5 minute walk.It's on the trolley line to the pier and museums.Excellent breakfasts and to our surprise the manager's reception each evening was like a whole meal. With pasta and salad bar, beer and wine too.The rooms were clean and comfortable. The bellmen were attentive and very cautious on security. If they didn't recognize you they asked why you were coming in to the hotel.We will stay here again when we go back to the Windy City.

Aug 2 2007 	Great location great value	I selected the Homewood suites after doing a fair amount of research as I usually do. My other choice was the Hilton on South Michigan because I could have had a much better deal albeit without food. I am so glad I chose this hotel instead. The Hilton seemed to be in an area that wasn't as nice. The Homewood Suites is very conveniently located and being there on a Wed. and Thurs. allowed us to save by not having to go out to dinner (the hotel has an evening meal on Sun - Thurs). The staff is friendly and the room was well-appointed. Wherever you choose to stay, I definitely recommend staying downtown if you are coming as a tourist. It is worth the extra money you pay. We had considered staying in a suburb and taking a train in but with the amount of things to do and see in the city, it would have been too inconvenient and time-consuming in my opinion. Also you can easily take the blue line train from the airport, change to the red line at Jackson (Washington is under construction) and it's a 1.5 block walk to the Homewood Suites.We *loved* Chicago and were very pleasantly surprised by the city. Very clean, tourist-friendly, polite people..... and there's so much to do. I would like to mention the free trolley. We decided to buy a 3-day CTA pass which allowed us to take unlimited trains and buses - that was the best decision we made. At the free trolley stops, people would be lined up waiting for a trolley and because the trolley made a loop and it was free, it was crowded and not very timely. We waited for 5 minutes max every time we needed to take the bus (we used them a lot since we have young kids) and always got a seat. It was so convenient. Also don't miss the bean!

Aug 2 2007	Could use some updates - location biggest benefit	As a business traveler - I have to differ a bit with some of the "family/leisure" reviewers that have given this hotel really strong reviews. Don't get me wrong - this place has a lot going for it: -- Price relative to other options in this area of Chicago (not "cheap" however)-- Easy access to lots of leisure/shopping destinations in Chicago-- Free breakfast that was of decent quality-- Multi-room suites etc (which is the point of the Homewood brand - beyond just this one hotel...)But compared to other hotels of this type I stay in it: -- Has older bedding including the dreaded "never washed" bedspreads that are disappearing/gone from most upmarket hotel chains-- Older kitchens compared to newer Residence Inns, or Staybridges-- Flat panels without HDTV (what is the point?) -- My bathroom needed renovation - it was very dated and showing wear Bottom line this hotel looks like a "partial" renovation to me and is profoundly average. It feels just a step better than the older generic suite product from Marriott, Hilton, IHG. It does not pop like the brand new hotels they are building - with updated amenities and decor. Sorry folks for the "studied" eye of a road warrior. I bet this is a great fit for personal travel, especially with kids etc in this part of Chicago. But within this type of hotel and this specific brand there are much better locations.

Jul 25 2007	Great Location . . . Will Stay Here Again!!!	My daughter and I just returned from our annual Chicago Trip to attend the Gift and Home Market. This was our first stay at Homewood Suites and I would definitely stay here again. We have stayed right on Michigan Avenue in the past, but prefer this location. It was quiet, the streets were not as crowded, and it sat right in the middle of all of our favorite restaurants. The hot breakfast buffet was wonderful! We had one of the smaller king suites and my only complaint was that the table area was too tight to spread out and work on. We would have been better with one of the larger suites. Other than that, our stay was perfect and the people were extremely friendly!!

Jul 24 2007 	Great family hotel!!!	After reading many reviews here at TripAdvisor, we selected the Homewood Suites for our Chicago family vacation. As soon as we arrived we knew we had made the right choice! The staff are super-friendly and helpful. The room was spacious and they have recently installed plasma TVs in the living room which was a nice surprise. We had an "accessible" room which had a HUGE bathroom, nice when 4 people are trying to brush teeth and get ready at once. The bedroom was large and the bed very comfy. The sofabed was fine and our two kids alternated sleeping on the sofabed and the floor, We did not use the kitchen much but it is a nice one and a good way to save money since there is a full service Jewel-Osco grocery right around the corner. We were on the 19th floor in the rear and had a spectacular view of the Hancock Tower.The amenities in this hotel are much better than we expected. The pool is nice, with great views and towels at poolside so you do not have to bring them from the room. The elevators are some of the fastest we have ever seen. There is fresh coffee and fruit available in the lobby 24/7. The bellmen are extremely courteous and knowledgeable about the area and how to get around. They even have free golf umbrellas when it rains, which it did one night. The breakfast service is excellent, but it does get very crowded when the hotel is full. They do a good job of getting people in and out and keeping the food stocked. The rooms are big enough that you can get your breakfast to go and eat it in your room. They also serve dinner with wine and beer Monday-Thursday with a different menu every night, which is posted in the room. We ate there the first night and it was a nice salad bar with delicious gumbo soup and make-your-own sundaes. Saved some money and time - we ate early and had time to go walk Michigan Avenue later.The location of this hotel is also unbeatable. It is a very short walk to the subway, near many wonderful restaurants (we recommend the Rock Bottom Brewery) and a block from a movie theater and shopping center.Overall the Homewood Suites provided us one of the best family travel experiences we have had. We have always been big fans of the Marriott Residence Inns, but this Homewood Suites was far better than any Residence Inn we have stayed at.

Jul 23 2007 	very nice	lovely hotel. great location. just down the block from free trolly stop.2 blocks from the red line subway. they give you a breakfat and a dinner each night. if you call they can tell you what is for dinner....soup and salad, chicago pizza, philly steaks ect each night is something different. they have a washer and dryer.the room has 2 tvs this is handy with kids. the king bed was very comfortable but the pull out sofa was very bad. you could feel every bar under the thin mattress. my kids are not fussy and it bothered them. the room and public areas were very clean.

Jul 20 2007	Wonderful hotel	This was one of the best hotel experiences my family has had. We travel a lot and this place has everything: great location, comfortable beds, quiet rooms, full breakfast, "happy hour" and reasonable price. I highly recommend it.

Jul 17 2007 	Will stay at Homewood Suites again!	We were very pleased with choice-had done much research prior to trip. Homewood suites centrally located, close to EL, valet parking reasonable, hot breakfast included, close to Michigan Ave.-we walked & took bus & El everywhere we went. Our room/suite was great - spacious,no outside noise, kitchenette. Concierge? was very helpful. We could not have been more pleased- definitely felt we got our $$ worth for Chicago & will definitely stay again!

Jul 10 2007 	Excellent value	DH and I spent 5 nights there for 4th of July week. We loved Chicago! We especially loved this hotel. When you go in, you register on the 6th floor (little weird). This a a comfortable hotel though, not your pretentious type at all. What it was lacking in glamour, it made up in hospitality. The people there couldn't be nicer. The rooms were fine for two. We ended up in a smaller suite, but that was fine for us. That's all they had for a 10AM check-in. I was just happy they had anything left for us to stretch our legs in. Now the true value came in the meals. Homewood Chicago offers you 2 meals (breakfast & dinner) M-Th. They call them light meals, but I wouldn't. Each night is a different theme and they have sides galore, and even a keg of beer and bottles of wine each night. My DH loved the unlimited beer! This saved us so much money! We just thought that this was a great place for a family. The pool was a bit small and the fitness room too, but they include daily passes to Crunch gym next door. My DH said it was a great gym! So overall our expereience EXCELLENT!

Jul 9 2007 	Excellent deal!!!	The stay was excellent. The amenities were more than we expected. Full continental breakfasts and dinner appetizers during the weekdays. Access to the Crunch gym on the main floor. Free Wi-Fi in your own room. The staff was very friendly and accommodating.Excellent location to the local restaurants and mass tran. Would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to others.

Jul 8 2007 	Great Location-reasonable rates	We paid $159 for a two room suite ( on-line nonrefundable rate). It included all breakfast meals and dinner Mon-Thurs. Great perk with three kids! It was nice having the two rooms when the kids went to bed. We had a great view from the 14th floor. We could see the construction of the new Trump Tower. Everyone in the hotel had great customer service from the valets, to front desk, and food service workers. We were about two blocks off of Michigan Avenue, on the same block as ESPN Zone, across the road form Nordstrom's. We did take the trolley back from Navy Pier. It stopped right in front of our hotel. We walked to Navy Pier because trolley service didn't start until 10 am.

Jul 2 2007 	Good Hotel	We stayed at the Homewood Suites for four nights 6/27/07 - 7/1/07.Pro'sVery hand location, close to Michigan Ave and the Red Line.Good sized suite with kitchenette.Several nearby grocery stores - Trader Joe's, Jewel Osco, another local one whose name I can't remember and not too far from a Dominick's and for some more upmarket ($$) shopping Fox & Odell's temptations aren't that far away on Illinois.Included breakfast buffet was very suitable for us, but might be a little limited for those into a hearty/varied start to the day.Included Mon - Thurs evening food was very basic, but you could use it to stretch a budget or to provide salad/sides for the meals you put together in your suite.Excellent mattressCon'sDifficult to shut doorLoose flush lever on the room's toiletDelays for lifts at a few busy periods.Would certainly consider staying there again next trip.

Jun 19 2007 	Good family place great service	We (family of 5 - 2 parents 3 kids) stayed here for 3 nights in mid March 2007. Coming from the airport, we chose to walk from the train - about 20 mins through the city. The hotel was easy to find and very welcoming. Our suite was well appointed with one room with two double beds and a pull out sofa bed in the lounge. There was a well equipped kitchen with fridge, microwave, toaster, coffeemaker etc. The accomodation was spacious, and we certainly felt that you could stay here in comfort for a week or longer.The room service was really helpful and excellent.The hotel was being renovated while we were there which meant that breakfast moved between two rooms. It really didn't matter to us and we found the breakfast more than plentiful, lots of fresh fruit, yoghurts, cereals as well as more calorific fare. The staff were friendly and very accepting of excited kids on the first day of the holiday wanting to try everything!!The hotel is well located for all the sights especially the magnificent mile and navy pier.Our best experience was when we were leaving to go to the airport, the doorman ordered us a taxi. When we got to the airport, my 13 year old discovered that her cell phone was missing. If you have a 13 year old, you will realise that this is a MAJOR deal. We contactd the hotel and they very helpfully checked the room - nothing. They put us through to the doorman, who knew the taxi driver, gave us his cell phone number. Sure enough the phone was in the car. He dropped it back to the hotel and they posted it on to us at no charge. You just can't beat that for customer care!

Dec 30 2006	Not As Requested/Assured	We pre-paid (no refunds) our 2 rooms on the internet and received a rate of $109 per room for 2 nights which is good for Chicago. Oct 18 2006	excellent choice for a family visit!	As everyone else says, the location is excellent. Not only is it very centrally located to trolleys and the 'L', but nearby is a chocolate factory that emits the most heavenly 'fresh-baked-brownie' smell into the streets surrounding the hotel in the evening. So, after a lovely day touring the city, we'd arrive back at Homewood and swoon over the lovely smell in the street (it doesn't enter the rooms or the building). None of the staff knew where it came from. They said it was the Hershey store, but that's all retail and quite a ways up Michigan Ave.To get there from O'Hare, you can take a cab (Around $20 pp shared ride) or shuttle (around $16-18 pp depending on how many in your party and if round-trip) or you can take the CTA (Chicago Transit Authority) blue line train which is $2 pp. The train (goes both above and below ground) is immune to the huge traffic backups and the ride takes about 45 min to get in to town at the 'Loop ' area. Transfer to the red line at Washington, go two stops to Grand, get out and up the stiars, and Homewood is a block away.From Midway, take the orange line in to the Loop area and transfer to the Red line and do as above.The free breakfast is wonderful. Several hot items, changed menu daily, all the usuall cold items, fresh (ripe!) fruit, very good for your family needs.At night, we ordered take-out from PF Changs. It's right on the corner. I'd bring it back to the room, then we'd order a movie in the room and have a lovely quiet evening out of the rain, resting our tootsies. I recommend the salt-and-pepper prawns, the name is strange but the taste is divine. And the side of spicy green beans. They aren't that spicy and they are delicious. I was happy to have the fridge and the microwave and utensils in the room to reheat our leftovers.Don't bother with the TV internet service. It is basically unuseable. Bring your laptop and use their free WiFi.Chicago. What a great town. My favorite discovieries, besides this hotel: the water fountain inside the Water Tower Place. It is very humorous! Your kids will crack up as they watch it and listen to it go bloop, bloop. Also, the Chicago Cultural Center, housed inside the former Public Library across from Millenium Park. Wow, the mosaic work and elaborate TIffany glass domes! Built at the turn of last century, when opulence was a goal, skilled craftsmen plentiful, labor cheap, and optimism high. Then came the stock market crash and the wars. If you love mosaic tile work, the Washington St entrance is one of the most beautiful examples in the word. Follow the amazing stairs all the way up to the fifth floor for the Bridge of Sighs replica.By all means, do everything in your power to see Wicked. What a terrific show! But I forgot to have my youngest ones prepared by having them watch the Wizard of Oz before we left, so they missed many of the references. That story has become quite a part of our culture, so it's important for kids to know about! Especially so that it's a good inside joke when you get off the plane on your return home, take a deep sigh and say, with everyone in unison, "There's No Place like Home".I will most certainly return to this hotel....it made a great trip very easy to do!

Sep 18 2006 	Good but a bit pricey for the service level	I stayed at the Homewood suites for three nights last week and had a good experience overall. There were some minor glitches and annoyances, but the staff went above and beyond trying to satisfy me. It seems some of the staff simply needed more training (there seemed to be a language barrier). Examples:One of the features that interested me about Homewood is that one can cook, which I love to do. Upon arrival, I noticed there were no pots and pans! Also, there was no sponge or soap (liquid or dishwasher powder) with which to clean anything if I did cook. There was no coffee, only decaf (BOO!). While there was a corkscrew, there were no wine glasses. I called the desk and, since it was late (10 pm), opted to dine out that night, but asked that the items in question be delivered the next day. Proper coffee and lovely pots and pans arrived, but no cleaning items. Also, I received JUICE glasses in lieu of wine glasses. I had a good laugh, but feel strongly that when you're paying $349 plus taxes per night, the staff should be able to distinguish the difference between juice and wine glasses. I called the desk again, and a very nice young man arrived with both red and white wine glasses and a sponge, as well as bottled water and cookies (peace offering). I was charmed and quickly forgave the error. Another negative was that while the front desk staff and housekeepers were very helpful, the gents at the concierge desk needed a little prompting. One in particular, Hanna, seems to resent being asked to do anything. Once asked, though, all of these guys seem to snap to it and hail cabs, book tours and say, "Welcome back", when I returned after a day out.My room was on the 17th floor with a gorgeous view of the Wrigley building and a sliver-sized peek at the river.
