The next time you are in the windy city, do yourself a big favour...& check into the Intercontinental Chicago!

Jan 15 2009	A really happy birthday for my wife	Everything from our spacious, clean, well-furnished junior suite overlooking the Magnificent Mile to the impeccable service at every turn made this a hugely satisfying experience. A special hats off to Agnieska who honored a requested room change (for a better view) without flinching. The location of the Intercontinental is such that walking to the upscale shops north or the Art Museum and theatre district south was easily doable and made taking cabs unnecessary. We have rarely had a more comprehensively positive hotel experience.Bert HudnallCharleston, SC

Jan 13 2009 	you'll love the Intercontinental	Just returned from a three day business meeting at Chicago's Intercontinental and it couldn't have been nicer. Staff goes overboard to accomodate guests. Jan 12 2009 	Great hotel and fantastic location	I stayed at the hotel one night. Jan 10 2009 	New Years trip to Chicago	Every year for the past 25 years, my wife and her sister, along w/ her husband, have shared New Years w/ a trip to the city. We use the trip to get away from everybody and everything to review the year just past and make plans for the year to come. Out of those 25 years, we have spent six of those years at the Hotel Intercontinental, Chicago. We have tried other places but the best has been the big "I." It is centrally located, great rooms, outstanding staff, and wonderful food. My brother-in-law love the "art deco" pool and work-out rooms. A great place to go after lunch when the sisters are shopping. Even better is the Lounge downstairs! We have tried other places in Chicago and the "I" always seem to come up best. For the last two years we have been spending the first few days of the new year at the Hotel Intercontinental Chicago and this most recent stay was the best!

Jan 10 2009 	Fabulous!	The InterContinental Chicago is FABULOUS! Small but lovely room in the Historic Tower. Entire experience, from check-in to check-out was perfect. Amenities are great, especially the indoor swimming pool!Food service was prompt, well presented and tasty.Can't wait to stay there again!

Jan 8 2009 	Good value - good location	After arriving from Washington we spent 5 days at the Intercontinental as part of our new year holiday. Clean, efficient and anonymous with nothing in the decor to offend (or please) anyone. The building is impressive  bring your swimming gear. The staff polite and helpful. The hotel is ideally situated for a holiday - better than staying in the loop I would suggest. Two minutes walk from the El and with plenty of buses stopping just outside. There were plenty of taxies, we never had to wait for one. Our kingsize room in the new tower was fine  a little small but nothing surprising given the location. Two concerns  the air conditioning and heating system were very noisy and could not be used at night, which meant a very cold room; and the plumbing was very noisy. The hotel was good value (average of $130 per night per room) providing we did not use the hotels additional services such as room service. The mini bar pricing was ridiculous with a bottle of mineral water costing nearly $7  stock up at the Walgreens over the road. Wifi was $50 a week. There is an OKish lobby bar and good wine bar attached. The lobby Starbucks was convenient when returning cold. If you are visiting Chicago and want somewhere convenient that just works this hotel is a good choice. If you are looking for something with a little more personality then look elsewhere.

Jan 5 2009 	Good choice	Spend five days here over New Year. Got a great deal on the Intercontinental website so I guess that was the main motivation for choosing this hotel. Plus the reviews on tripadvisor were overall good. Could not fault the hotel. Stayed in the "new" tower. Room was very comfortable - occasional noise from neighbouring rooms but it did not last long. Took breakfast on two occasions in the restaurant and found it good. Location is excellent - at the upper end of the Mag Mile it allows easy access to all the shopping plus the loop area for museums etc. At the price - would certainly recommend.

Jan 4 2009	Customer service is back!!	After many stays at comparable hotels, I can say that this one was by far the best experience we had in a long time! Dec 29 2008	Perfect Location	The hotel is perfectly located for shopping and dining. The accomodations were just what we needed for a quick get-away. The staff was friendly and helpful. Still, overall this was a super choice.

Dec 27 2008 	Great location good hotel	This is a great location in the city, especially for shopping up and down Michigan Avenue. For the money, however, I thought the hotel was decent but nothing to rave about. The rooms in the main building are fine but quite small. My wife offered ID and a checkbook with both names on the checks but needed to ask for a manager to allow her to check in. Dec 26 2008 	Good Value Friendly Service	My room was a corner room on the 30th floor, with great views the lake and Tribune building. The bathroom was very very nice. The food provided at the meeting room break outs was above the level of comparable properties where we have booked conference space. The service as always helpful and friendly.

Dec 26 2008 	Great Value in Chicago!!!!	What a great place!! Recently had the opportunity for a quick overnight in COLD Chicago with my family (wife and 2 young daughters) to soak-up some big city Christmas cheer and let the girls do some swimming. This hotel was perfect. The property is just beautiful. We had a large King in the Historic tower with a great view, large bath (w/ separate shower), plenty of floor space (the girls love to bring the aerobed), and overall very nicely appointed. The Historic tower is worth a visit even if not staying in the hotel. Very beautiful well-mainted structure with an interesting history. The pool is awesome (but could be a few degrees warmer-honestly my only very minor complaint). Big-time kudos to the management staff for hiring, and properly training, such a great bunch of genuinely nice people.We've stayed at many of the nicer properties in Chicago and I can't think of a better place to get the most "bang for your buck"!Can't wait to go back. Hopefully, it will be warm enough to actually enjoy a stroll along Michigan Ave!!!

Dec 24 2008 	Thanksgiving Stay	If you need a place right in the middle of the Magnificent Mile, this is the hotel for you. It took a couple tries to find it driving in from the east, even using my Garmin. However, once we pulled up to the front, our bags were handled efficiently, and our room was ready as promised. Of course, for a better view and a larger room, we were offered to upgrade to a more elite status in our travel club. I did so, but am not sure our view really changed much. The check in process was smooth and our room quiet and comfortable. I never appreciate Internet fees and didnt like that their Internet service was not free. Also, parking is very expensive in most downtown Chicago hotels, so avoid bringing a car unless you really need one. The hotel location is right across the street from Nordstroms, making shopping easy. There is a Starbucks in the downstairs lobby, which is nice for a quick breakfast. The restaurant/lounge was frequently busy, but our service was good. If you can get a rate for around $160/night I would take it and avoid the upgrade to something more expensive.

Dec 22 2008 	Best Hotel in Chicago	This was my second stay at this hotel. I chose it as part of a package made available through Hotwire.com. When I saw it as one of the options, I seized the opportunity to stay there again. This time I was able to take my wife and we had all of our expectations exceeded by the staff of this superb hotel. We arrived early and were able to check in, even though it was prior to noon. For a small fee, we were able to upgrade our accomidations and enjoy a spacious room with a great view of the city. I have to speak again about the staff at this hotel. It was probably the most friendly I have ever encountered in my travels. They were quick to help with any questions we had about the city, how to best get around, attractions and places to dine. I certainly will stay there on my next visit to Chicago!

Dec 20 2008 	Mike Cohen Appreciation	Our stay was great and even greater by the entire staff and the attention they gave during our stayWe look forward to our next stay at the InterContinental and the staff in Chicago

Dec 16 2008 	Quality Intercontinental Experience	We stayed three nights at the Intercontinental Chicago and from the start it was a pleasant experience. Dec 16 2008 	Would love to go back!	We were upgraded to a suit, which was lovely! The property itself was amazing, our entire stay was very enjoyable. I recommend just wandering around the hotel, as there is lots to look at!It's also in an excellent location for walking or public transportation.

Dec 14 2008 	Overrated overpriced	For the price, this hotel does not offer many amenities. Internet costs $16 for 24 hours. If you forget toiletries, you are better off walking down Michigan Ave. to the Walgreens because the hotel charges you four bucks per item for shaving cream, razors, toothbrush, and toothpaste. Other, less expensive hotels I've stayed in, give these items free at the front desk.The central benefit to staying in this hotel is the location. It is right in the middle of the Miracle Mile, and most of the things you want to see are within walking distance. Overall, the rooms were fine, although I don't think the bathroom was well-cleaned. There was hair on the edge of the bathtub. However, there really wasn't anything special about this hotel or its rooms, and for the price, I'd rather have stayed in a Best Western or Holiday Inn for the free Internet.

Dec 12 2008 	Great Hotel Experience	I travel quite extensively for business and travel to Chicago on a frequent basis. Before this most recent year I was a regular guest at a different hotel chain. I began to search other locations based on location of client meetings. I decided to give the InterContinental a try. My first stay was very good so I decided to stay at the hotel again for this most recent trip. I was pleased to have ANOTHER great experience. When the cab pulled up to the hotel I was greeted by a friendly bellman who helped me into the hotel. It happened to be the coldest day since last February so I was doubly appreciative of the smile on his face. The hotel was nicely decorated for the holidays (which makes the business travel aspect of my life a bit more special). The front desk staff was very attentive and welcoming as I checked in. The room was very clean and well appointed. The hotel continues to implement GREEN initiatives and does a good job of communicating their mission and the many ways they are trying to help our envirornment. Both the room service delivery time and food was very good. In addition, if you have an opportunity to visit the bar and are hungry, be sure to order the mini-sliders on pretzel bun. They were very delicious but also found the chef's presentation to be very creative.I am planning to make the Hotel Intercontinental my new home-away-from home when I am in Chicago. I am very pleased with the consistency and quality of service and the genuine good nature and professionalism of the staff. In addition, if I ever have an occasion to travel with my family to Chicago, the hotel would be a great location first because of the service but also the pool is great and would be another activity for the kids. There is also great shopping but in particular the hotel is located across the street from an indoor Mall with lots of great stores (including Nordstroms)!Give this hotel a try, you won't be disappointed.

Dec 11 2008 	Great Location Friendly staff	Hotel is right in the middle of everything Chicago has to offer. Large hotel with great architecture, you can choose to stay in the new more modern tower othe the charming historic tower.Friendly staff with great service! I will definitely be staying here again on my next trip to Chicago!!Oh yeah, and a full service "real" Starbucks in the Lobby.

Dec 11 2008 	Very nice weekend getaway	Great location in the shopping district. We booked this room via Hotwire and received a good rate. When we checked in early at 1PM they upgraded our room to one with view of the lake. Room was perfect. The bed was comfortable and the staff was very curtious. My wife and I found the lcoation to be walkable to everything. I had heard the parking was $49 per night so I drove around the block and found a garage for $25 per day since we didn't need our car anyway. Great stay/great hotel.

Dec 11 2008 	The InterContinental Doesn't Disappoint	I'd had very satisfying stays at InterContinental Hotels in Europe before, but never had stayed in any of their stateside properties. As soon as you drive up to the hotel you notice the architecture of the building. Housed in a former Shriner's Athletic Club, the structure is a refreshing change from the cookie-cutter layout of many large hotels. It has character. My room was larger than I expected and nicely furnished. The bed was comfortable and the bedding not too smothering like some other hotels. The closet was large and the flatscreen TV was a nice surprise. I had a very good buffet breakfast in the restaurant. The bar was a little on the small side, but the selection of beers was good. Overall, I very much enjoyed my stay at the InterContinental. My only criticism would be the cost to valet park a car is a hefty $50 per day, with no option for self parking. Dec 8 2008 	Finest Hotel	From the muinute we got there to the time we checked out, the staff was very friendly. The hotel is clean, with great decor. The location is a perfect, you are so close to many attractions. Even if you did not want to leave the hotel, you have everything you need right there. We will always stay at the Intercontinental Hotel Chicago!

Dec 7 2008 	Great Service nice Hotel	We booked short notice this hotel before Thanksgiving looking forward to enjoying the pool. We have been staying many times in CHIC but never got to stay at the Interconti. Dec 5 2008 	Great Stay	I've stayed in many hotels through business travel. The InterContinental in Chicago was definitely a very nice hotel. Service was friendly and helpful. Dec 5 2008 	Our kids love this hotel!	This is the 2nd time we've stayed at the hotel. It is our favorite in the city. We love the swimming pool, but it happened to be closed the week we were there. Dec 2 2008 	Great hospitality	The InterContinental Hotel chicago was a great romantic getaway for my husband and I. When we first arrive the door man greeted us with his knowledgement on the hotel and the city. We was very impress with his willingness to make us feel comforable and relax. I am not sure if the InterContinental Hotel trained all their employees to overwhelm the customers with kindness or if it was just this young man personality. Dec 1 2008 	Thanksgiving weekend at Intercontinental	My girlfriend and I spent two nights over the Thanksgiving holiday at the Intercontinental. This hotel was very beautiful throughout most of the interior and exterior the adjoined restaurant/bar and Starbucks was enjoyable and convenient for day and night time city walkers like ourselves. The best aspect of the hotel is its location in my opinion. It's literally right on Michigan Avenue, head just one block North and you're dead in the middle of the Magnificent Mile, famous for fabulous shopping and boutiques. The lobby was ornate and gorgeous with some crowd issues during the night time, since it was not a very large lobby. Check in was rather easy. We had booked the room weeks in advance via Hotwire and recommend that method if possible, of course it's not feasible to know with 100% accuracy that you'll get the Intercontinental when booking through them, but if it's a 4 Star in the Loop you may be in luck. I believe we paid $130 a night. The history behind the hotel is rather extensive and unfortunately we did not have the time to check out all of what the hotel has to offer in terms of historical significance. Although I did wander lost in the the historic tower a bit after getting ice! The building and towers are a bit confusing in the L-shape turn hallways that lead into different sections of the hotel entirely without you noticing when you head up or down stairs. But the pool must be seen. It's one of the most beautiful indoor pools that I have seen. As for the room, it was extremely cozy and reminded me of the Palace Hotel in San Francisco a few weeks ago, so much so in fact that the Screen Saver on the plasma tv was exactly the same and playing the same hypnotic tune, on the neutral Hotel channel. The refrigerator was packed with overly priced alcohol and soft drinks. I'd rather have the space to store leftovers or my own alcohol from stores down the street to be honest. The room itself was much less spacious than the Palace, and in general was very tight. It had a Queen Size bed and a 3 cushion couch tucked near the window. Not much room to put any large luggage without it obstructing your walkway to and from the door and bathroom. The bed was comfortable and the TV was a pleasantly large HD flat screen. My particular view being on the 12th floor overlooked the backside of the neighboring buildings and street. So not a very awe-inspiring view, but then again it wasn't a special room in the historic tower nor a suite. The concierge were well informed and found information with extreme ease and speed. I recommend walking to Trump tower and if it isn't the winter time definitely check out the architecture tours down the Chicago River. Check out was very easy through Instant Service on your phone, simply leave the card keys in the room after they verify any additional charges and at 12:00PM. Overall, the Intercontinental is one of the prettier hotels in Chicago, but it's most attractive feature is its centralized location to the downtown shopping area. Some negatives are the unusually small lobby for such a nice hotel and small rooms with the small refrigerator stuffed with high-priced booze instead of leaving space for personal boissants. If you are into shopping and want to see the architecture and cultural center of the city this should be a definite place to stay for under $200 a night.

Oct 1 2008 	Well-meaning but laughably poor service in this Intercontinental in name only	I'm currently staying in the Intercontinental Chicago and, having stayed at the Intercontinental Kowloon twice, and the Grand Intercontinental Seoul once this year, it is puzzling to me that this is part of the same chain. The Kowloon and Grand are spectacular with outstanding service (the Kowloon has what is probably the best view of any hotel in Hong Kong - even better than the Peninsula, another fantastic hotel in Kowloon). The Chicago Intercontinental is mediocre at best, with some well-meaning but laughably poor service and a management team that is in deep denial regarding what is required to be a true first-class hotel (or even a middle tier business class hotel).It started at check in: I always request a quiet, king, non-smoking room. They gave me a room with two twin beds facing Michigan Avenue. Okay, fine - sometimes that's how it works out. But I don't expect any Intercontinental to have paper-thin walls allowing me to hear normal conversations in adjoining rooms, as one has here in Chicago.Then I called to have some clothes pressed for my meetings the next day. Three calls later they had yet to pick up my clothes, and kept telling me that I needed to fill out the laundry request form, refusing to hear that there was no such form, nor the normal laundry bags, in the closet. I finally had to leave the clothes on the bed in order to make it to the restaurant on time. I discovered on my return that the clothes had been picked up, but instead of simply being pressed, as I had requested, they had sent them out to be dry cleaned. Perhaps they are looking for additional revenue? (more on that below) We'll see if I get them back in time for my meetings in the morning - but my confidence is not high.Then comes the business center. They have one, but it doesn't have a copier, the printers don't work, and there is no one available to help fix them. The best they can do is suggest you try printing from all the PC's in the business center, where one is charged a minimum fee just to log in and discover that one is unable to print from any of them. As a result, they get to charge you to log in to all their computers, but then go back to the front desk where they charge you again for the privilege of making black and white copies of the deck you needed in color. Must be a great marginal money-maker for them, along the same lines as the airlines charging $10 for those disgusting appetite suppressants they call food in what has become nothing short of peasant class.Oh yes, and now it is close to midnight, and, despite trying to get 15 simple decks printed at 9:30 PM, I still don't have them.Finally, my patience at an end, I provide some feedback to the hotel management and get whiney excuse after excuse about why none of these things are their responsibility, in a tone that suggests they are doing me a favor by providing any service at all. A true first-class hotel will at least step up and own the facts, but not the Intercontinental Chicago - they are just hapless victims of a cruel landscape over which they have no control whatsoever.Avoid this hotel if you can - Chicago is packed with other hotels that charge the same rate for fantastic rooms.

Sep 3 2008 	Great Location Pretty 	I stayed here last year when accompanying Hubby on a trip he needed to make for work. I was on my own during the day while he attended a conference. The furnishings were rich and sumptuous, the bed extremely comfy and clean. A small sofa was situated against the window, and we had a fridge to use. We didn't get to use the pool in the hotel, but we checked it out and it's very nice. The hotel staff was very helpful whenever I stopped for recommendations or directions.We both became enamored with the city and will be back again, to explore some more -- four days is not enough! We'll probably see if we can get a room at the InterContinental again. When we stayed here together, we were both very happy with our room, the service, cleanliness, and location.

Aug 5 2008	For the Price Should be Better	The Chicago Intercon is a pretty hotel in a great location, but the rooms are tiny and the bathrooms are like something you would expect in a budget hotel. When I returned home from my stay I noticed a $300.00 charge to my credit card, beacuse I had used no other hotel services other than valet I called to question. After 6 attempts (the accounts receiveable clerk was on vacation, transfered to dead end extentions and being placed on hold to die) I was finally able to speak to the manager on duty, who told be that there was no charge on my account (even though I was looking at the statement) and it was a problem with my bank. After being placed on hold, I was told that I had in fact been charged twice for the room and the charge would be reversed. Opt for the historical location.Some things to consider:They have "packages" that allow you to bundle breakfast, Internet connection, gym access. I purchased this and saved about 50% if I would have paid for each individually. The breakfast is fantastic, not up to a Ritz, but far better than most.The service at the hotel was very very good and the room was very comfortable. The location was great . I really liked this place and would definitely stay here again

Jun 12 2008 	Had a good stay	Stayed for one night during my stay at Chicago. Booked it at Hotwire and gotten a good offer considering the location of the hotel. I am surprised that the hotel is ranked 40+, considering that the room was pretty good and the bed was comfortable. It is along the magnificent mile and is accessible to different places. The hotel had a rich history, do check out the indoor swimming pool, reminds me of the old pool in the 60s.Do consider this hotel if you plan to visit Chicago.

Jun 9 2008 	Excellent Location - Nice Property	From the start this was a good stay. The front desk staff were pleasant and very accommodating with my early check-in. The room was decent and well distributed. Overall, this was nothing less than I would expect at an Intercontinental property. The location was awesome with everything a few steps away, literally. I would stay here again.

Jun 4 2008 	We were pleased	Check-in went smoothly but since we arrived so late (11 pm) there were no non-smoking rooms available with king size beds as we had requested so we took a non-smoking room with 2 doubles. A full size bed just isn't comfortable for the two of us so we each took a bed, not a big deal but I wish we would've arrived earlier to claim a king. We stayed in the new building on the 20th floor. We inquired at check-in about getting a room with a mini-fridge and the front desk clerk told us to request a fridge from housekeeping. They delivered one to our room the next day and it was free of charge. This saved us from having to go out to eat breakfast every morning since there is no complimentary breakfast at the Intercontinental. We bought cereal and milk and a few other items at the Dominicks around the corner. We were very satisfied with our stay at this hotel, all the employees were very helpful and nice. Just be aware that there aren't many free extras here. Food is expensive, both in their restaurant and by room service, and the goodie basket/mini-bar is of course overpriced. Wireless internet costs over $10 a day, so we left our laptops behind. Use of the fitness center/pool is also expensive so we didn't indulge. We paid $120 per night by booking through Priceline.com, we probably could have gotten an even cheaper rate if we'd waited longer to book but I was worried about getting a good hotel since we vacationed over Memorial Day weekend so I booked early. Our room was clean and comfortable and the staff was friendly and helpful. Location can't be beat, we would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Jun 3 2008 	Surprise at the InterContinental	I was on a government trip and this hotel was one of the few good ones with the government rate. Upon check-in I was surprised to be given a special room on the 41st floor which had a elevator entrance, two bathrooms, loads of room, and great views. The hotel staff were outstanding and very friendly and hhelpful. The food was great. My only regret was that I hadn't brought someone to share it with.

May 30 2008 	Great Location Interesting History Lackluster Service	Stayed here for 4 nights over the Memorial Day weekend. Only chose this hotel due to the fact that my family was attending a professional organization's yearly meeting held at this location. I was a bit concerned about staying here due to the many negative comments left by previous visitors. I have to say that overall it was not as bad as I had anticipated it would be. The location is great. The loby is very small and gets very crowded and noisy. I was able to check in early and get a decent room in the Historic tower--pay the extra money as it is definitely worth the view. All of the rooms are very small but comfortably decorated. The bed was pretty hard and the maid service was very spotty (despite tips and notes being left for them). I learned that the hotel has quite a history and that an audio tour is available. The meeting rooms on the 2nd-4th floors were quite a surprise--I won't spoil it for you--you MUST check out these unusual and beautiful spaces. The fittness area was quite nice, as is the pool. You must check out the pool--Ron Howard's film Cacoon "pod pool" sceen was filmed here. The meetings that I attended here were well done. The food and service were above average for such a busy and large hotel. There were many weddings, receptions, and meetings going on at the same time and the staff handeled them very well.This is definitely not a "4-Star" hotel, so don't expect it to be. There was no service whatsoever. The concierge was a joke, as were all the restaurants in the hotel. In short, the location and history are great. The meeting facilities were good. The room was small, clean, and comfortable. Service bad. Check-in OK. You must go eat at MK restaurant and Frontera Grill--both phenomenal and worth the price of the trip. The Sofitel and Peninsula are the primo choice for this city.

May 29 2008 	All of the good none of the bad!!	Had made reservations at another downtown hotel, based on price, but still read every Intercontinental review, wishing and hoping we could stay there. Shortly before the trip, I found an ad on Travelzoo for the IC for a price less expensive than we were paying for a hotel two blocks off Michigan, and booked it immediately.Got in after an early flight, and the doorman met our taxi. He gave us receipts for the bags, and told us they would bring them to our room when the room was ready, so we were pleasantly surprised when we were told they had a room on the 25th floor ready for us then. We were checked in, and on our way to the room before 11am! AND, our bags beat us to the room! No upsell attempts, no glares because we had booked through a third party website, just a pleasant, quick, and courteous process.The room was small, sure, but no surprise there. It was, however, clean, comfortable, and very well laid out. Not much drawer space, and a beautiful flat screen TV that we put on for a total of 5 minutes to check the weather report. The view was facing the other tower, so nothing great there, but, I wasn't there to sit and look out the window.The room was quiet, even though it backed up to the elevators (didn't hear them, even once). The room was made up perfectly by the housekeeping staff...everything immaculate, everything fully stocked. Beds were extremely comfortable.The location is the prime #1 reason to stay there. Walking distance to everything, and overall, I have to say, this was the best hotel stay I have had in a long time. Highly recommend the Corner Bakery (they are everywhere) and, before you go here, do your homework, read the reviews, and go in with an open mind. You will be glad you did.

May 27 2008 	Historic spendy and great location...	Well here we are on the last day of our four day stay over Memorial Day weekend and we have had an overall positive experience here. We paid the extra $50 on the advice of the earlier write-up and are glad we did. The view out the window on the 36th floor is spectacular, esp. room 3603. The folks here have been friendly, much like the city itself. There is one notable exception to this friendliness and that resides at the oENOology bar in the hotel. These people act like rejects from a bad fashion show in their snootiness and indeed the males there are just hostile at the outset. Prices in ENO are high, but the cheese and location is good. Try the Hook Cheddar if must patronize the place. It is great. Otherwise, there are many other places to have that preprandial libation.  You cannot beat the location of this hotel for Chicago.  The rooms are small. My parents room was like a shoe box. I understand that in the historic tower, it is a grab bag, but given the nick for the room rates, overall I would go another location down the street (Trump, Peninsula...if your wallet can stand the meltdown of your credit cards). If you do stay here, wander the meeting rooms on floors 3-5. They are amazing (the place was built by the Shriners and is quite historic.) Get a view room to be happy.

May 20 2008 	How to have a great state at the Intercontinental Chicago	I've stayed at the Intercontental Chicago about 9 times. Most of the items I was booked at the hotel through Priceline, however, I have booked it direct with the hotel on several occassions.Here's how to have a great stay at the Intercontental. BE POLITE TO THE STAFF. They process hundreds of people each day and you'd be surprised how wonderful they are when you walk up with a smile and a hearty hello. I stay at the ICH Chicago a few times a year and I had always paid to upgrade to the historic tower. Always. It's a $50 upgrade, but well worth it, especially if you paid only $100 or so on priceline. When you buy the upgrade, try to get to the hotel right at check-in time and ask to pay for the upgrade. Don't ask for it for free... they never do it. Be very polite and ask for a corner room with a view of the river. However, if you go to chicago more than a twice a year, ask about the Intercontinent Ambassador program. I never join hotel programs, but one of the phone clerks told me it seemed to be a good fit for me. It's $150, but you get the following:1. Automatically get all your rooms upgraded to the historic tower. I used to pay $50 a night for this2. Early check-in. Usually they get me in at noon.3. Fruit, chocolate truffles, and Evian waiting in your room.4. Late check-out 4pm. Automatically. I love this.5. You get a FREE weekend night with the purchase of a FRI or SAT night stay. Let me explain how this worked on my first trip when i used it.I bought the program for $150. I booked Memorial Day weekend in Chicago. The city was booked solid, so my cheap room was $229 at the ICH Chicago. But I get upgraded to a $280 room and I got a second night free. Not to mention all the added perks, I saved $330 on my first trip for the $150 program. Plus I'll use it for upgrades throughout the year. Such a good deal if you visit even once or twice a year.Valet Parking is expensive ($50 per day) but the service is impeccable. Internet is also expensive ($15 per day if i remember right)... I wish it was free or maybe a one-time fee regardless of length of stay. Otherwise it's a great hotel with a great staff. Avoid eating at Zest. It's very disappointing.

May 13 2008 	Expected so much more	I am sad to report that the Intercontinental Chicago was a waste of money and my priority club points. I expected so much more from a high end property and received so little. As a priority club Platinum (40+ weeks/year in priority club properties) I had some basic expectations such as express check in, friendly staff, a bathroom bigger than 3' X 3', clean rooms. At check in I had the huffy clerk who complained that she had to merge my record because I was using points and paying for my stay. She never looked me in the eye and made no attempt to be friendly. It went downhill from there. I noticed on several posts that some reviewers recommend getting the ambassadors club membership, but I would not pay a dime for that! I have spent over $21,000 on hotel stays this year so far and should not have to pay a single cent more to get some decent treatment and a decent room. Please heed the warnings of your fellow travelers and DO NOT stay here. I am from Chicago and believe me there are better properties where you will get what you pay for.

May 13 2008	Wonderful Experience at the InterContinental	The hotel is great -- clean, quiet, beautifully decorated, good locaton and excellent, if not superior, service. I am sorry I did not get to see the pool.I would stay there again. In fact, when I travel, I now research InterContinental Hotels first.

May 11 2008 	Bustling Hotel Great Location!	My husband and I stayed here two days while in town just for fun. We booked through Hotwire and were very pleased with the hotel, especially considering we paid only about $120 USD per night. We arrived at the hotel at about 10:30 in the morning fully expected to have to wait a few hours to check in, but were able to check in promptly. The only problem was that they were going to put us in a room with two double beds. I explained to the man that we supposed to have a king bed, and we would be more than happy to wait. He got a little agitated and told me that I could upgrade, and that if I book online, I am not guaranteed any certain room. I quickly explained that I had called to check my reservation two days prior and a certain girl with reservations had confirmed that I was guaranteed a king bed under my name and that we wouldn't mind waiting until a regular king came available. As soon as I said that, a king "room" popped up and we were in our room in a flash. Other than that, we had no problems with the hotel. Our room was on the 20th floor in the regular tower. It was small as some other reviewers noted, but there was plenty of space for the two of us. I liked the room because it had the feel of a European boutique hotel. The location of this hotel is probably the best hotel for shopping because everything is just right there in front of the IC and you can just head down the mile. We did have one meal (breakfast) at Zest and it was fine. Overpriced like all hotel breakfasts, but it was fine. Nothing spectacular and nothing bad. We had to check about 4 hours before we were scheduled to the airport, so they were able to hold our bags at the bell desk while we shopped some more. This is a great hotel for business and tourists alike.

May 6 2008 	Good Hotel but....	First the good aspects - the rooms in the old tower are excellent - the swimming pool is fantastic ( and the staff in the gym area are great too). The situation of the hotel is tremendous and Chicago is a fabulous city. But, I wasn't able to check in until 9:30pm as the "room wasn't ready" , the dates that the check in people had were wrong and they took some persuasion that I had booked the room I was told that I would have to move room during my as the floors were being renovated - but that the room I was being moved to would be of the same standard - no problem. I was also asked to have my stuff ready for the morning of the move as the staff would move it. I came back later that day to get my new key only to be told that I had "checked out" - after a lengthy discussion I was told that I was still checked in and given a key to another room. The room was half the size of the previous room and next to the lift area - During the time that I was outthe airline rang the hotel to ask them to tell me that my flight had been cancelled - only to be told that I had "checked out" so I missed the revised flight time. - Thanks!

May 6 2008 	Overpriced; Bad service; Great location	A colleague and I are currently staying in this hotel on business.The stay has been characterized by bad service and total lack of attention to detail:- No maid service provided for more than 1 full day, despite room service garbage lying around (half eaten food, etc.)- No laundry bags in room- Package shipped to hotel temporarily lost; Hotel requested I pick up rather than delivering to room once found- Room service unable to accept food order temporarily- Front desk clerk insisted on giving 2 keys to 1 person despite repeated requests for 1 key only- Front desk clerk did not provide mini bar key- Doorman provided wrong directions to nearby destinationOne might say the above are minor (except maybe the maid service) but at the prices charged (> $400/ night) one would expect near perfection and in my experience one would get it elsewhere.The hotel has a great location on Michigan avenue and my room is nice enough, but there are many other hotels nearby including the Swisshotel, Sheraton, Fairmont, Hyatt, and many others.

May 1 2008 	Had my ipod stolen	Had my ipod stolen while I was there. Management had me fill out paperwork for a claim. I was then directed to call a number to process the claim where the person would never pick up the phone and would never return a message. They said it wasn't their fault, you were warned not to leave anything valuable not locked up and you can't prove that anything was really stolen.

Apr 29 2008 	would never go again...	I had never really thought of going to Chicago ,but a friend was going on a convention and asked me to go .After much research of Chicgo it sounded like a great place....Especially the Intercontinental!! When we arrived everything SEEMED really nice and we even Accepted the 50.00 upgrade. After thinking about it now ...that even seems ridiculous!!! The room was indeed larger with a pathetic view....and it was HOT so HOT in fact we were forced to ask for a FAN!!! Being from the SOUTH we are use to hot wheather but my God....having to open a window in a 5 star hotel? Tacky ,Tacky!! The mini bar had a Jr. size can of pretzels for 6 bucks..charming to say the least! Apr 28 2008 	Very Disappointing Hotel	I booked one night at this hotel on Hotwire, and was very disappointed at not only the facility, but the poor level of service. When we drove up, no one came to the car to offer assistance with bags, parking, etc. The 3 of us staggered through the lobby doors with all our bags, while the hotel staff stood and watched. No one tried to even assist with the doors. The lobby is not particularly impressive, low ceilings, nothing distinctive. There were 3 chairs, yes, 3 in the lobby. The front desk person first tried to sell us a more expensive room, when she saw there were 3 people on our reservation. For $50-150 more per night, we could indeed get a nicer room. I wanted to stay with the $130 I was already paying. She said she was giving us a "nice, larger, corner room, with a particial view of the lake." When we opened the door into the room we were shocked at how small it was. There was not even adaquate space to access both sides of the bed. Both beds had about 8 inches of wall clearance. One of us had to crawl in and out from the foot of the bed that night. There was no view of the lake, only the side of highrise condos, nothing but concrete in sight. There is room for ONE suitcase in the room, that is it. If you use the space available for the one, you also forfeit access to the window, as it blocks the narrow passage on that side of the room. The closet is approximately 40 inches wide by 14 inches deep, so very little storage there. We were climbing over our 3 suitcases and several smaller bags the entire time we were there. The bathroom is very small and poorly designed, complete with the type of industrial toilet found in a sports stadium. The toilet was dirty with brown grime around the base and lid. The shower was clean, except for the black mold in spots along the grout. I contacted the front desk to see if a mistake had been made, since this was not the "spacious corner room with a lake view" that I was told of. They would not acknowledge that a mistake had been made, and I was given the same speech on "upgrading" for a fee of $50-$150 if I desired a "nicer room." I tried a third time, a little later, to resolve this issue, but by then I was convinced I was talking to a robot. The same speech on handing over more money if I wanted a decent room for my family. The star rating of 4.5 or 5, depending on which website you are on, is inappropriate for this property. 75% of said "amenities" are not included in the price of your room, therefore they are not true amenities, and must be purchased at additional cost. The final insult were the condoms that are available for purchase in the basket of snacks on top of the mini fridge. My child discovered these along side the $4 Snickers bar and the $6 mini can of Pringles. The Intercontinental rivals Motel 6 for level of service, inadaquate facilities and overall tackiness. (My apologies to Motel 6, as that may be an unfair comparison.)

Apr 28 2008 	Nice Hotel but way overpriced	I stayed here for 3 nights on a leisure trip. The hotel is a fantastic location, and bellman/staff at front dest - were all excellent. The room was a king in the historic tower on the 19th floor, quiet, clean - however - way overpriced. I did pay full price for the room, but did not find the "value" of it to be worth it. Amenities are average, not first class which is what they market to the public. The maid service, cleanliness of the room were all great, but beware - there are a lot of hidden costs staying at this hotel - one already pays enough to stay there, but then you have to pay nearly 50.00 to park, 12.00 to use internet, 20+ dollars to workout, plus, plus, plus. Beware of the hidden costs, and book your room though hotwire - they offer no special discounts if you call them directly. For the full price - I expected a lot more. no turn down service, (i'm sure that would have cost extra) - overall a good stay for sure, but if you can somehow get the cost down....you might feel better about your "value" for your dollar during these hard times.

Apr 27 2008 	Loved Chicago - who cares about the hotel!	The best thing about this hotel is the location on the Magnicent Mile, just walk outside and stroll down this street and immediately you notice the overwhelming array of shops and department stores. A shopping paradise for serious shoppers. The open top bus tour (hop on/hop off) station is also just two minutes away. Check in  We arrived at 5.30am and had booked a room for the previous evening, so check-in was easy and efficient especially at this time of the morning. We did notice later the hotel is extremely busy and queues were often seen.Room- Our room 556 faced Michigan Avenue the Magnificent Mile we had no real view as we were placed on the 5th floor. The room had a king size comfortable bed with lovely feather down pillows. A huge plasma TV sat on top of a cabinet and a good size-working desk was handy for catching up on work or e-mails. No broadband but Wireless High-Speed connection, which worked extremely well. A long red sofa bed was placed beside the large windows. Mini bar, safe and wardrobe were also neatly tucked into the comfortable spacious room. The room is not modern but had a 1930s dcor, which created a soft and cozy atmosphere. The bathroom was standard size with a shower over the bath; good quality Damana toiletries were also generously supplied. Breakfast  The breakfast is located on the second floor in the Zest Restaurant. One can order from a menu or have the hot buffet meal, which also includes a chef-cooking omelets. We thoroughly enjoyed every meal.Bars  There is a comfortable lobby bar offering cocktails, beer and wine located just near the reception. Eno is another bar, which is located in the Historical Tower lobby level and offers more than 300 varieties of wine and 35 different types of cheese and a selection of handmade gourmet chocolates.Next door to the hotel is Starbucks coffee shop, which we found incredibly handy.Facilities  There is a fabulous heated swimming pool located on the 12th floor in the Historical Tower. The pool is a junior Olympic size with beautiful blue Majolica tiles with a fountain of Neptune on the east wall of the pool. The gym is also located on this floor. An ATM machine is located just near the Business Centre in the Historical Tower on the lobby level.Overall  I have given the Intercontinental Hotel 5 star rating for being a beautiful landmark building located in a prime position in Chicago offering comfortable quality rooms. Theres nothing I can say I disliked and we thoroughly enjoyed our five day stay.We actually loved Chicago with its excellent shops/restaurants/cafes it's a fabulous city for any traveller to visit.- highly recommended by Ellemay !! Shops or food - its hard to decide which gets my 5 star!

Apr 26 2008 	What a disappointment	We stayed here several years ago and had a vague but favorable recollection of the visit. We stayed in the older part and enjoyed the traditional but updated room. This time our suite was in the newer tower and was not charming or comfortable. The windows were too high for looking out and so dirty that our limited view was obscured. The sofa bed for our daughter was the worst we have encountered. All this for a price that seems much higher than in the past. In spite of the great location, I doubt if we will stay here again.

Apr 22 2008 	Price of parking was ridiculously high!	After a wonderful day & evening in Chicago, my husband & I were very unpleasantly surprised to find out upon checking out the following morning that the parking fee for one overnight at InterContinental Chicago was $49! Yes, this hotel is right on Michigan Avenue, and yes it was a nice room, but $49 for one overnight of parking seemed inordinately high. (We booked our room through HotWire, which does not give you the parking fee costs before you book, so we'll also be very leery of using HotWire again.

Mar 29 2008 	Great experience -- get the hotwire price	The Intercontinental is a great hotel, with helpful and pleasant staff. It's in a very central location, just north of the river on Michigan Avenue. The facilities are high quality, and there's a very good wine bar connected to the hotel.But you will normally pay relatively high prices for it. We were fortunate in that we got our reservations through Hotwire and paid a very economic price. One negative: they charge for extras like Wi-Fi and the gym. Mar 28 2008 	better than advertised	I stayed here two nights for a meeting, and I am much happier than most reviewers. My room was a corner room with a king bed. there wasn't a lot of walking area, but everything was here, including a robe and couch. I liked the furniture and decor, and the TV is a big flat screen. The bed and linens were excellent quality. I did not find the staff unhelpful. In fact, I found everyone nice. The wine, cheese, and chocolat bar was really good, and they serve their food in the regular bar area, which made for a pleasant evening. People are right who complain about the hotel charging for everything, but if I paid $100 on hotwire or priceline for this, I would be extremely happy. the workout center is very good, and the pool is absolutely gorgeous - a throw back in time with lots of chairss, tiles, a real deep end. Do not miss this if you are a swimmer. In short - great location, very nice hotel, and a bargain if you get this via a discount broker given everything.

Mar 25 2008 	Great Hotel........Awesome price through Priceline!!	My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for four nights. Booked it through price line at $100/night (taxes included). Nice hotel and great location!Would stay there again.

Mar 23 2008 	Fantastic Stay!	We recently stayed at the Intercontinental Hotel for a week. The hotel was in a wonderful location and the service was great.We found all of the staff very helpful and prompt.We highly recommend the Intercontinental for any travel needs whether it be for business or pleasure.

Mar 17 2008 	Good Hotel Excellent Location	I recently stayed at the Intercontinental. I booked throught Hotwire and it was around $100/night which was absolutely worth it. The hotel is right on Michigan Ave. across the street from Nordstrom and Starbucks is in the hotel too. I was able to walk to the Hancock Observatory (15-20 min walk), the art institute and Millenium park (15-20 min walk) and all the major malls and shops. The hotel itslef has a nice lobby and the rooms are clean and relatively modern looking. Our room was small and I couldn't get a room with a Queen and had 2 double beds instead-but not a big deal. The concierge was able to give me advice and a list of where to go, maps, etc.. They did however want to charge you for everything you wanted to use (internet was pretty expensive, the fitness/pool area was I think $12/pp just to use it, toothbrush etc)It wouldv'e been nice if they had a jacuzzi as we did a lot of walking and it was very cold so it would've been nice to come back to that at the end of the day but oh well!Tip: The Subway (Blue line) from the O'hare airport (ORD) was very easily accessible and only $2 per person. It's almost an hour ride and then when you get out of the subway just grab a cab and it's a $5 ride to the Intercontinental airport. But, if you have really heavy luggages or a lot of luggages, there was a point when you get out of the subway, there's a flight of steps to get out onto the street. Overall I was pleased with the Intercontinental hotel and would stay there again. If I was paying a lot more, though, I wouldv'e expected a bigger room with a queen bed. I don't know if that was just there standard room, or if I got that room because I booked it through Hotwire.

Mar 10 2008	nice place	Beautiful hotel with a really neat wine/chocolate/cheese bar adjacent. Our room was clean and quiet. We had a view of the lake which was nice. The pool was gorgeous!!! We didn't use it but we did go down to check it out and were impressed--the pool water was warm. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because the hotel charges extra to use the workout room--I thought that was a little lame. The pool was free though. We'd stay there again but I would be disappointed if I paid a lot for the room and then couldn't workout.

Mar 9 2008	Service doesn't come close to 4 stars!	The hotel is beautiful. Nice flat screen TV, great view of Magnificent Mile, nice furnishings. We got the room for $79/night through Hotwire. To be honest, I wouldn't stay here again, even if it was $59/night. The service was terrible - the concierge was away from the desk, and no one else would help us find a good place to eat/drink/dance. Finally, someone told us about a great place to go on the other side of town - Sangria. We had a minor with us, and he said that they accepted 18 and older in the club. So, we took the $15 cab trip there, and Sangria told us that it was 21 and up only. So, we went all the way back and complained. We asked the front desk to refund us for the cab rides, but they said that they couldn't do that. They gave us a coupon for a free drink, but by the time we got back from our room, the bar was closed. Everyone behind the front desk except for one person treated us like we were just second rate. On top of all this, EVERYTHING costs extra - even the toothbrush/toothpaste, just in case you forgot yours, costs $2. If you have an endless pocketbook and love to tip generously, I'm sure your stay would be wonderful, but if you're like me, you'll grudgingly hand over $1 by $1 for tipping and extras, adding up to be just as much as you spent on the room originally!
Mar 9 2008	great location	great location! walking distance to many of the chicago hotspots

I know this is a chance you take on Priceline, but felt we were *caught* in having to upgrade to a "historic tower room" just to fit a rollaway in the room (we had 3 adults). We still got a great rate and ended up paying less than $100/person for 2 nights.The room itself was nice, but not great. We looked South at another tower (new?) and could see a silver of Michgan Avenue. The bathroom vanity area is TOO NARROW. It's ridiculous in fact unless you're a man or woman w/no hair products, make-up or hair appliances.The outlet situation is worse. There is ONE outlet accessible near a mirror outside of the bathroom (which does have an outlet, but no space to set a hair dryer or curling iron) and it has the nightstand light and clock already plugged in. You can use the mirror in the dark (unplugging the light) or without knowing the time (unplug the clock). Would it kill them to offer a power strip? Another outlet is available nearly behind the tv (no mirror nearby) or by the desk (with NO mirror again). Apparently women aren't supposed to get ready anywhere but the bathroom (with the tiny vanity).The sink drain was locked shut upon arriving and required a call to Housekeeping to open. The promised rollaway (which was to be delivered between 12-1 p.m. per the front desk) was not in the room at 6 and after 1 call by us and 4 callbacks from "Tiffany" (I will give them credit for checking back with us) it arrived near 8 p.m. The service was apathetic for the most part and although the location is perfect and the hotel itself is beautiful (tour the meeting areas on 2-4), I think this is just an average hotel, maybe 3 star, but certainly not 4.

Mar 3 2008 	Will return hopefully soon	First off, we got a great deal through Priceline which is risky. Sometimes it works, sometimes it doesn't, but this time, my husband and I scored big! We experienced three situations that required a phone call to service, who responded in a very timely manner and followed up with a phone call to make sure we were satisfied. Even when we called at 2:00a after a night out and discovered the heat wasn't working properly. They were in our room within 10 mins and fixed the problem. We had wine, cheese and chocolate at the wine bar ENO. The cheese/chocolate/wine selection was awesome, but unfortunately the service was SLOW! We got there around 7:30p on a Sat. and the wait staff seemed completely overwhelmed and not at all prepared for the Saturday crowd. Not at all romantic. We would return in a heartbeat.

Mar 2 2008 	Will return!!	Maybe it was because we were coming from staying in the Embassy for a couple of nights, but I was totally impressed with the InterContinental Chicago. Feb 28 2008	Great location but average hotel	I want to be fair. The place is decently decorated, the rooms are clean. But it doesn't feel like a 4 star. The location is great for Michigan Avenue shopping and sites. For those who don't mind lackluster service, the hotel isn't that bad. The price was also reasonable.

Feb 23 2008 	An oasis on Michigan Ave	Stayed at the IC Chicago several times. Keep returning for the location, pool and fitness center. Walk out the door right onto one of the most vibrant streets in the US. I am a bit of a pool buff and the IC boasts my favorite indoor pool in America. Fitness center includes some free weights, good range of machines, and a sauna.Service is pretty good, although check in lines can get a little too long during busy times, and although the staff are very professional, they are not as friendly as you expect at a top notch hotel.

Feb 20 2008 	A great introduction to one of the great cities of America	My wife & I drew this hotel via a conference at which my wife was presenting. It was a wee bit pricey (even by conference-rate standards) but we wanted to be sure of a good night's sleep after a punishing trip from Australia. We were not disappointed!The building is truly lovely - a mixture of renovated 1920s and more recent. We offered an upgrade via their travellers' club (I forget the exact title), where the membership more than paid for the upgrade (plus assorted discount / accommodation vouchers). We opted for this after an exhausting 31-hour journey from home, and were very glad to do so - 2 large bathrooms, a living room and a huge comfy king-size bed.Our area was very quiet, and the room was quite dark with the heavy curtains drawn - almost causing our downfall the next day, as we slept solidly until 11am (due to jetlag) and my wife's showtime was 1pm (my fault - I should have set alarm).Staff were very good and obliging. Door staff were friendly and efficient (and many of them were cricket fans, so we talked cricket a bit). Service problems were promptly fixed - the CD player in our room was not working but a replacement came within 10 minutes of a call.There were no tea-making facilities in our room (eg electric kettle), but house staff very obligingly brought a jug of boiling water each morning at the same time (we used to this to make our own breakfast).Location is mind-boggingly great - at the top of the Magnificent Mile and within cooee of the business district. The short walk to the subway station is a bit obscure - not signposted, and you have to cut through the Westfield Centre over the road - but we figured it out by studying the map plus asking concierge.We did not really use the restaurants in the hotel. Thanks to the great location we were happy to try different cuisines in the neighbourhood. We did visit the bar late at night (weeknights), and found it restful and quiet (which is just as we like it).Chicago had a unusual early-spring snowfall during our visit. The footpaths were generally lethal, but the door staff assiduously kept the footpath in front of the hotel de-iced. This was the true mark of their magnificent service - attention to small but potentially very uncomfortable) detail.The hotel has a business centre, including pay-as-you-go internet on in-house computers. As we did not have our own computer present i do not know if there is WiFi to rooms.I cannot comment on car-parking facilities because we used public transport.All in all - a truly memorable stay! Extraordinary.

Feb 18 2008 	Excellent location	This hotel has a great location! Right on N. Michigan Ave., you are within walking distance to everything. Feb 16 2008 	Excellent Stay	My boyfriend and I went to Chicago the week of Jan 28-31. We stayed at the Intercontinental. Before we went we signed up to be a priority member which was free to do. The staff was very helpful especially the concierge. We didn't eat at any of the hotel's restaurants because there were so many options around. The location can not be beat. You can walk anywhere. Feb 16 2008 	Good location	We had previously stayed at the Fairmont, but they were unable to accommodate us, so recommended this instead, and we thought it was better than the Fairmont, and the location was excellent.We got a good rate for a junior suite, which was lovely, with good sized rooms. However, at dinner, the restaurant seemed very cold - even though it was below freezing and snowing outside, we got the impression that they hadn't turned the heating on in there until we sat down. Feb 14 2008 	Solid Service and Amenities with Great Eco-Practices	The Intercontinental Chicago is centrally located to the Magnificent Mile, has nice guest rooms with good amenities, a Starbucks inside the property, and solid service.On top of all of this, the hotel has a couple of very special features:-an aggressive greening campaign throughout all of its operations - including energy efficiency, waste management, water efficiency, and guest communication about eco-friendly activities.-a spectacular art deco swimming pool and several common spaces that are truly unique and grand in an historic, old-hotel glamour way.My stay was competently executed for the most part; the bellman was particularly accomodating. My only complaint was that my 5 am wake-up call came at 5:30 - but anybody who depends solely on the hotel wakeup call and doesn't set their own alarm deserves what they get. Beds were very comfortable with high quality linens; even small rooms and nice extra furniture and room to work.

Feb 6 2008 	Sweet!	Great location, great price. You can run towards the lake down side roads. Close to shopping and tonnes of restaurants. Safe surrounding area. Few blocks from closest train station!

Feb 4 2008 	great location and price	Our family stayed for 3 nights, 18-21 Jan, and we were very happy with the location and price thru' Hotwire of $99 per night. Feb 2 2008 	InterContinental...Great location to enjoy Chicago.	We stay here every time we visit Chicago. Located right on Magnificent Mile with lots of shops and restaurants right outside the door. Jan 27 2008 	5* Service. Outstanding	The Intercontinental Chicago is a world class hotel. My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The Intercontinental is a fine hotel that truly cares about its guests.

Jan 25 2008 	Solid Business Hotel	Very solid service and nice rooms. Ask for an upgraded room as they usually will accomodate requests if possible. Beautiful 1920's archecture that is well worth exploring the hotel. The roof top pool is not to be missed.

Jan 3 2008 	Nothing Great!!	My wife and I stayed over New Year's and found the hotel to be nice, but nothing special. Jan 3 2008 	Beautifully decorated	We visited Chicago from December 30th, 2007 to January 2nd, 2008 and we stayed at the Hotel Intercontinental Chicago. We decided to wait a half hour and ask again. One girl told us we would have to wait another two hours for a room with a view but when we asked another girl she searched very thoroughly and found us a room right away. Dec 27 2007	Great location nice room	This is a very nice (not exceptional) business class hotel in a great location for shopping on North Michigan Avenue. The room was fresh-feeling and not very spacious, but not cramped, either, i.e. typical of a renovated hotel from another era. The bed in room 1842 was comfy; the heat was "responsive" on chilly nights; the bathroom is good but not luxurious, although there was a nice range of toiletries and counter space to spread out. Exellent housekeeping. There were all the other things you expect of a good business-class hotel, e.g. in-room safe, coffee maker, etc. Since we were at leisure on a short stay, we did not test the internet connections or the fitness center (lots of power shopping and museums instead.) There is a $48/night parking charge, which is very typical for this area of Chicago. There are in/out privileges. I don't understand the complaint of another Tripadvisor poster re: having to wait in a cold garage -- the car was quickly brought around to the front when we wanted it.There are various restaurants and a Starbuck's on-site. We only used the Starbuck's and the cafe for breakfast since we were in the mood for eggs, panakes, etc. The latter was fine, and service excellent, although they should improve the coffee (can I bring in a Starbuck's?) There is also a more lavish breakfast buffet, but we generally don't go that route.The Eno wine/cheese/chocolate bar looked nice, but we were busy with other things. My usual complaint about these places: the music was grating Euro-techno-loud something, not conducive to sipping wine. I would have asked them to turn it down (or off) had we stayed for a while. The other complaint is minor and happens: we had difficulty checking in when the desk could not find our reservation, and this was one of the few times when I had the confirmation number buried somewhere. 'Can't say whether it was their fault or the cedit card tgravel agency we booked with (we used bill-back miles, using a good room rate) but even after checking both my husband's and names, there was still a no-go. We booked a spare room, and then settled it with out CC company and the hotel afterwards. For some reason, we were booked using my husband's first name as the last name. Someone should have thought about this possibility.The room in general was quiet, but it faces North Michigan Avenue to the north. The holiday lights were ablaze, but we could also hear the occasional siren going by.Still, the room was ready, and we could check in early. Everyone was very nice and polite. While not in the same league as a Ritz or Four Seasons, we'd be happy to stay here again. But then again, we good a good rate, not the posted rack rate that would put it in league with those other hotels.

Dec 16 2007 	Nothing special	Now this is a five star / four diamond hotel, so it's still pretty nice despite the low score. It's just that when I go to these types of establishments, I have high expectations. The building is very nice as are the public areas. Combine this with a top-notch location right on Michigan Avenue and a short walk to the theatre district and you can't go wrong, right? Wrong. First of all, there are many little issues with the way this place was remodeled. It looks like the construction guys were a little sloppy. The curtains in my room were coming off the roof, some lids on the floor were a little offset recovering dark nasty holes, door frames were obviously repainted by a non-professional handyman etc. These are little things, but aren't the little things what you fork the extra dollars for?I just hate that when you pay $200 plus for your room, they have the guts to rob $10 for a wireless internet. The worst part was, it didn't even work. I complained and didn't need to pay for that which is the least they can do. I think they should add some access points to strengthen the signal and make the access free like so many of the 3 star -type of places have (Hampton Inn, Garden Inn, Fairfield Inn, you name it). I wanted to go to the fitness center after a long drive to drain some sweat. Guess what, guests have to pay for it!Breakfast was nice, and it needs to be when it costs as much as a good dinner. To top it off, they made me wait 15 minutes in the cold garage to get my car. Is this why I paid a $100 for valet parking for two nights? There was nothing wrong with the attitude of the staff and the receptionist was courteous and nice when I said I didn't want to pay for the internet. I think the issues with this place are related to management. If you get a good deal here, go ahead and stay. It's not a bad place. It just should be better.

Dec 14 2007 	Lovely hotel	The hubby and I stayed here for one night to do some shopping and relaxing before the crazy Christmas rush. If you do, I don't understand the surprise at checkout.This is one of the few hotels downtown with a pool, and it's the nicest one we've seen. We didn't use it, but something to consider if you think you'll have time.A breakfast restaurant in the hotel would have been nice. Starbucks is the only option and we're not fans.All in all, we thought this was a wonderful hotel, very nice staff and wouldn't hesitate to recommend.

Dec 5 2007 	Great hotel with a fabulous location!	For a weekend shopping trip around the holidays, we wanted something right on Michigan Avenue. Nov 25 2007 	Love Shopping? Stay here.	We stayed at the Intercontinental on Thanksgiving night. The lobby wasbeautifully decorated for Christmas with a large tree and many poinsettas. Nov 24 2007 	Best of Chicago	We loved this hotel and we have stayed at alot of hotels in Chicago( including Palmer House which was awesome). Nov 23 2007 	NIce hotel in a great location	We stayed at the Intercontinental for three nights last weekend. Nov 13 2007 	Classic elegance in Chicago with prime location	PLUSES:* The hotel's location is fantastic - right across from the Nordstrom shopping area on Michigan. * I stayed in the Historic Tower -- huge corner room with views of Michigan Ave. * The room's decor was attractive -- classic and elegant. * Very comfortable bed and NO sounds from neighboring rooms.* Strong wireless internet signal in the room (but there is indeed a daily fee to use it)* Gym is very nice and clean, with lots of cardio equipment. Oct 23 2007 	Nice hotel; great location	Stayed here for 3-day weekend. Great location. Lots of attractions in walking distance. Beds were wonderful and room in historic tower was very nice. Great views and the windows open which was great for some fresh air. Changed from 31st floor due to banging we kept hearing for 24 hours (sounded like someone jumping on the floor above us). Hotel was gracious in moving us to 37th floor, but had breakdown in communication as to why we were moving. In the morning, told us to leave our stuff and bellman would move it; just pick up key when returning at day's end. When we came back at 5pm to pick up our new key, they then asked all sorts of questions which should have been noted already. So it was annoying to reiterate the whole banging noise, engineer you sent up heard it, never got back to us, etc. Both rooms we had were very nice. Bathrooms have a lot of marble, nice tub and separate shower. Nice toiletries too that smelled great! Amazing lap pool--one that must've been shown in movies. Interesting how you must shower first--you have to walk past the attendant to get to the pool from the showers; this rule is apparently enforced. Pool does not smell like chlorine which was great. Didn't eat there so can't comment on food. Check on internet access--some get billed and some don't. There's a Starbuck's on the ground floor too.Took doubledecker bus tour first thing and saw the whole city. Next day went to Space & Invention museum (taxi cost $20) and then to Millennium Park. Walked around the City and shops, etc. Hancock Tower was cool at night. Fox & Obel store near hotel was great. Lobster club sandwich was so good I went back next day and got one to go for the plane ride back to NJ (United serves/sells NO food in flts < 3 hours). I'm sure the cupcake we ate on the plane was the envy of passengers around us. Nice upscale store with a great "to-go" selection too. Ditka's had good food for dinner. All within walking distance of the hotel. Hotel staff was very courteous.Used Continental Van service from/to airport. Paid r/t at airport but next time would taxi back as the p/u was late and driver had attitude toward everyone. A LOT of traffic to and from airport. Leave about an hour to get there.Overall a good experience.

Oct 17 2007	This is the only hotel I will stay in while visiting Chicago!	After reading some of the most recent reviews I'm really perplexed. Oct 9 2007 	Great Room for the Price	I got a $120 room rate from Pricelines name your own price. It got way to hot and then you couldn't get it any cooler. But all in all I would stay at this hotel for the normal room rate which is twice what I paid.

Oct 5 2007	Great service and fabulous location	I stayed at the intercontinental during the last weekend in September for a "pleasure trip" -- the InterContinental was in a great location and the staff was excellent. (and possibly raising to 11%)Great stay. I highly recommend it and would stay there again.

Sep 27 2007 	First Class	The service and overall feel of this hotel is First Class. I was treated like I was a King. The rooms were very clean and smelled clean. Sep 22 2007 	What an amazing hotel!	I've travelled a lot to Chicago, and after many, many trips my family and I have finally found the place we will always return to. Sep 18 2007 	Location Location.	Sometimes its all about location, and this can't be beat- n the Mag Mile a block north of the Chicago River. Booked a 'double' room at an amazing rate thru Hotwire. Room was very nice- great view of Wrigley Building, Tribune Building, NBC Tower, out to the lake. (Strange thing about the room though- limited clothes storage if you want to actually unpack your suitcase- no dresser!) Bathrooms very nice and updated. Overall, my opinions are greatly influenced by the rate I received thru Hotwire. Yes- it was clean with a great location. But at full price (sometimes $300 or more per night), i think i would want a little more pampering from the Intercontinental Chicago.

Sep 10 2007 	Beautiful Intercontinental Chicago!	This InterContinental Hotel is absolutely wonderful in every aspect. First, you cannot beat its location right on Michigan Avenue. Sep 4 2007 	Excellent Stay	My wife and I stayed at the Intercontinental for one night, the Sunday during Labor Day weekend. Aug 31 2007 	Loved it.	I went onto priceline.com and selected a 4 star hotel in the river north area of Chicago. The price I entered was $90.00, I figured this was a long shot. My request came back immediately, and i was booked into the Intercontinental for just 90 bucks. I then emailed the hotel directly and requested a non-smoking room, (priceline can't guarantee you a non-smoking room, FYI) on a high floor with a nice view. We packed up the family and headed to Chicago with our fingers crossed.I couldn't have been happier with a hotel, even if we had paid full price, it still would have been great.What's good about it?The location. Right downtown on Michigan Ave. next to the tribune building, near the river, walking distance to Navy Pier (By walking distance, I mean our two kids, 7 & 8, walked without complaining).The hotel itself is very nice, there are two restaurants downstairs, Zest and Eno. One fancy, the other really fancy. and a bar. There's also a Starbucks attached to the lobby. There's probably two more across the street, but who's counting?I can only review the room we stayed in here, but it was awesome, lots of open space, large plasma TV, large marble tiled bathroom, comfortable beds, very clean. The room actually felt new. The view from the window as you're going to sleep was of the Tribune tower, the Wrigley building and the Sears tower, among the other building which I don't know the name of. I probably could've found a cheaper lot, but driving around Chicago is stressful if you don't know where you're going. So we just took it on the chin for parking.$9.95 a day for internet access. There are so many place offering free wifi, it just doesn't seem right to find a place that still charges.The restaurants and bar are pricey. OK, so I only went to the bar, but $6 for a bottle of Goose Island? At the pool there are lane dividers and signs on the wall that say "lap swimming only." In the pool, there are a few old people with swimming caps and goggles on, doing laps.The pool is very nice, but not for families with kids, and for us that's a pretty big deal. because if the kids can't enjoy the pool, we can't enjoy the pool.All in all, great place to stay. Park, eat and swim somewhere else.

Sep 15 2006	Great Staff Clean Rooms Super Pool Convenient Location	This is a great hotel. It is now a La Quinta property but with the same great staff. I have stayed here dozens of times over the past 7 years. Always great, always friendly.

Oct 19 2009 	Loved it!	Our room was spotless and we had a great view of downtown. The bed was very nice and comfortable. There is a 24 hour shuttle that will take you to Midway and the CTA station. Jul 30 2009 	Super Convenient 	Booked this one through priceline for the last night of a recent trip for $95 (a jaunt to Indiana to see family book-ended by good times in Chicago). May 19 2008	...got my money's worth	Flew into Chicago-Midway for the first time. Was spending three nights to tour the City. But the difference in nightly rate for most is small (less than $30) so decided on the Marriott. All the hotels have access to a shuttle service (every fifteen minutes) to Midway. Once at Midway it is easy to jump on the ORANGE line train that takes you downtown in about twenty minutes. For a two-day pass (unlimited travel) the tarif is $9 purchased in the Midway station. Jul 21 2008 	Something for everyone!	I stayed at the Oakwood for 6 weeks on business. I couldnt have been happier with the experience!My company booked this for me. Its also close to two subway stops.The staff couldnt be friendlier or more helpful. They make an effort to get to know you, and will bend over backwards to meet your needs.My apartment was lovely. I stayed in a one bedroom, which suited my needs just fine. The combined living/dining area was spacious, furnished with a dining room table, a little desk, living room furniture consisting of sofa, loveseat, and end/coffee table, along with a nice TV armoire. The bed I had was king size, and the bedroom had a TV as well. Theres an enormous closet in the bedroomin fact, for what it is, theres plenty of closet/storagein addition, theres two closets in the other living area. The kitchen was quite fully furnished with dishes, utensils, and pots and pans (all I would have hoped for that wasnt there was a pizza wheel), with a full size fridge and stove/range, and a dishwasher. A toaster and coffee maker are also there. My dishwasher did not seem to work well at all, but I did not realize this until the end of my stay. My view overlooked the Hard Rock and Rainforest Cafes, and the big Rock and Roll McDonaldswith a view of the downtown part of the city beyond. It was a very cool nighttime view. Also notable, the building is amazingly quiet, it doesnt appear to have the standard thin hotel walls.Housekeeping services were optional, but my company sprung for weekly services. The housekeepers vacuumed, cleaned the kitchen and bathroomand the bedroom as well when my dog was not there. They run all dirty dishes through the dishwasher. As mine worked poorly, that just made more work for me, but I am sure the Oakwood will remedy this now that they know its broken.Theres no shortage of restaurants in the neighborhood, and great ones at that. In addition, Michigan Avenue is a short (maybe 4-5 blocks) walk, and the lakefront is just a few blocks beyond that. Given the train stops that are so close, you can easily get anywhere from the Oakwood. There is a parking garage attached to the Oakwood, so if you drive, your car is always conveniently nearby. They will issue you an access card so you can come and go easily.You have to look for pet friendly outdoor locations for your dog todo what it has to dobut theyre around. Just a block over on Superior, my dog was satisfied with a strip of mulch and grass. A little longer walk (maybe 4-5 blocks) and youre at Washington Square Parka lovely little oasis in the city, and a great place to meet other dogs. I originally planned on jumping through the hoops to gain access to the citys Dog Friendly Areas, but they were all just a little too far to be practical and used enough. Jun 4 2008 	Oakwood Chicago great stay great price	Stayed at the Oakwood Apts in Chicago and couldnt have had better at the price I got. 2bed 2bath fully furnished heated pool sauna the works located next to Hard Rock cafe, close to house of blues and only four blocks from Michagan Ave. Cant beat it and the staff was great told me of some great eating spots. Apr 1 2008 	Perfect for the Price	This turned out to be perfect for our girls trip to Chicago. Very close to shopping and restaurants. We had two large bedrooms, two bathrooms, a living area, and a kitchen. Since there was a Whole Foods around the corner, we were able to stock up on breakfast and snack supplies. The front desk was very helpful with recommendations and directions. This is normally used as corporate housing, so things seem a little different than a traditional hotel. Furniture was a little worn, but linens were very nice. There were TVs and extra towels in each room and the kitchen was stocked with cookware. The price was about $100 less than an other hotels in the area, and we loved the extra space.
